item.title: 美国 40% 的奶牛感染禽流感，加州农场陷入困境
item.description: 加利福尼亚州的奶农正在努力应对不断蔓延的禽流感疫情--他们中很少有人愿意公开谈论这个问题，但没有人能够忽视这个问题。【原文：Dairy farmers in California are grappling with a steadily advancing outbreak of avian flu in their herds – a problem few of them want to talk about publicly, but that none of them can afford to ignore.】

item.title: 前高盛合伙人为直接借贷业务积累 16 亿美元资金
item.description: 私人信贷公司 5C Investment Partners 由高盛集团的两位前合伙人共同创办，在积累了 16 亿美元的高级直接借贷交易资金后，将开始进行投资。【原文：Private-credit firm 5C Investment Partners, co-founded by two former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. partners, will begin investing after amassing $1.6 billion for senior direct-lending transactions.】

item.title: Chrysalis 提高 Klarna 估值，金融科技公司准备上市
item.description: 在 Klarna 可能于明年首次公开募股之前，该公司的一位股东提高了对这家金融科技公司的估值。【原文：One of Klarna’s shareholders upped the valuation it assigns to the financial technology company ahead of its potential initial public offering next year.】

item.title: 臭名昭著的犯罪头目成为印度-加拿大争端中的关键人物
item.description: 在印度和加拿大因锡克分离主义领导人被暗杀而外交关系破裂之际，聚光灯现在转向了印度最臭名昭著的黑帮之一。【原文：As diplomatic relations fray between India and Canada over the assassination of a Sikh separatist leader, the spotlight is now turning to one of India’s most notorious gangsters.】

item.title: 尼日利亚与国际金融公司签署奈拉融资协议以降低货币风险
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行和国际金融公司签署了一项促进本币融资的协议，希望在提高奈拉需求的同时，帮助企业避免外币借贷的汇率风险。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank and the International Finance Corp. signed an agreement to facilitate local-currency financing, hoping to boost demand for naira while helping firms to avoid the the exchange-rate risk of borrowing in foreign currencies.】

item.title: 特鲁多的竞争对手承诺取消许多新房的联邦销售税
item.description: 保守党领袖皮埃尔-波利瓦尔（Pierre Poilievre）表示，如果他当选总理，将取消加拿大对售价低于 100 万加元（71.97 万美元）的新房征收的 5%的全国销售税。【原文：Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said he would remove Canada’s 5% national sales tax on new homes sold for under C$1 million ($719,700) if he’s elected prime minister.】

item.title: 斯堪尼亚计划全面转向 Northvolt，收购电池公司
item.description: 大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）旗下的卡车制造品牌斯堪尼亚（Scania）计划为其未来的所有电动卡车配备 Northvolt 电池，这是对这家资金短缺的瑞典电池制造商的信任投票，因为该公司正在努力达成一揽子救援计划。【原文：Volkswagen AG’s truckmaking brand Scania plans to equip all its future electric trucks with Northvolt batteries, in a vote of confidence for the cash-strapped Swedish battery maker as it works to seal up a rescue package.】

item.title: 调查显示：哈里斯或特朗普执政下，美国财富都将增长
item.description:
两位候选人的股票都有望上涨。特朗普被认为对黄金和比特币更有利，而哈里斯则对住房成本略微看好。【原文：

Stocks are expected to gain under both candidates. Trump is seen as better for gold and Bitcoin, while Harris is slightly more positive for housing costs.

】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州的一个城市希望取消天然气
item.description:
自由派伯克利分校的居民将就限制在建筑物中使用燃料的第二次尝试进行投票。【原文：

Residents of liberal Berkeley will get to vote on a second attempt to curb use of the fuel in buildings.

】

item.title: 人工智能推动数据中心需求增长，DigitalBridge 收购 Yondr
item.description: 数字桥集团公司（DigitalBridge Group Inc.【原文：DigitalBridge Group Inc. has agreed to buy British data center developer and operator Yondr Group Ltd. as the investment firm seeks to profit from the boom in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利认为财政收益将缓和南非的 "垃圾 "评级
item.description: 人民币摩根士丹利（RMB Morgan Stanley）认为，南非在经历了多年增长乏力之后，经济前景不断改善，这将带来更好的财政指标，并可能很快导致其垃圾级债务的升级。【原文：South Africa’s improving economic prospects after years of lackluster growth will result in better fiscal metrics and may soon lead to an upgrade of its junk-rated debt, according to RMB Morgan Stanley.】

item.title: 飓风灾后重建取决于美国大选中心的移民问题
item.description: 东南部各州在遭受两场毁灭性飓风袭击后的重建工作有可能因关键的工人供应短缺（即移民）而停滞不前。【原文：The efforts to rebuild in Southeastern states after a pair of destructive hurricanes are at risk of being drawn out by shortages of a critical supply of workers: migrants.】

item.title: Swiggy 旨在下周中启动价值 13.5 亿美元的印度 IPO
item.description: 印度食品配送平台 Swiggy Ltd. 正寻求在首次公开募股中以每股高达 390 卢比（4.64 美元）的价格出售股票，可能会筹集 13.5 亿美元。【原文：Indian food-delivery platform Swiggy Ltd. is seeking to sell shares for as much as 390 rupees ($4.64) each in an initial public offering that may raise $1.35 billion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Meta 在人工智能眼镜规范化方面取得进展
item.description: 随着消费眼镜与人工智能语音助手的融合成为常态，Meta 公司的雷朋智能眼镜可能会成为本周财报中的一个亮点。但首先...【原文：Meta's Ray-Ban smart glasses could be a bright spot in its earnings print this week as the mashup of consumer eyewear and AI voice assistants becomes normal. But first...】

item.title: 科氏签署首笔以回收率承诺为支撑的锂交易
item.description: 科氏公司（Koch）与美国一家锂风险投资公司签署了一项协议，将提供一项业界首创的技术，保证利用其新的提取方法从咸水中回收至少 95% 的金属。【原文：Koch, Inc. signed a deal with a US lithium venture to provide technology that includes an industry-first guarantee of recovering at least 95% of the metal from salty water using its new extraction methods.】

item.title: 波音抛售 190 亿美元股票以提高流动性
item.description: 波音公司启动了一项近 190 亿美元的股票出售计划，旨在解决这家陷入困境的飞机制造商的流动资金需求，避免其信用评级可能被下调至垃圾级。【原文：Boeing Co. launched a nearly $19 billion share sale meant to address the troubled planemaker’s liquidity needs and stave off a potential credit rating downgrade to junk.】

item.title: Bharti Airtel 的利润因一次性收费而低于预期
item.description: Bharti Airtel Ltd. 公布的季度利润低于预期，原因是 7 月份推出的资费上调所带来的收益未能抵消一次性费用的拖累。【原文：Bharti Airtel Ltd. reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit as gains from tariff hikes introduced in July failed to offset the drag from a one-time charge.】

item.title: 贝尔菲斯银行寻求发行 AT1 债券，这是本年度最大的扭亏为盈活动之一
item.description: 贝尔菲尤斯银行（Belfius Bank SA）正在寻求新的额外一级资本，以偿还一笔债券，该债券之前看起来可能会打破市场的提前偿还传统，但却成为今年表现最好的债券之一。【原文：Belfius Bank SA is seeking fresh Additional Tier 1 capital to repay a bond that previously looked like it might break with the market’s early repayment tradition but instead became one of the year’s best-performing notes.】

item.title: 决定市场成败的 10 天
item.description: 金融市场即将迎来关键的两周。【原文：Financial markets are heading for a pivotal two-week stretch.】

item.title: 英国交易商期待里夫斯公布 2930 亿英镑的债务销售计划
item.description: 债券交易员预计，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）本周将提出有史以来最大的借贷计划之一，试图在政府促进经济增长的承诺与财政纪律的呼吁之间取得平衡。【原文：Bond traders expect the UK to present one of its biggest borrowing plans on record this week as Chancellor Rachel Reeves attempts to balance her government’s pledge to boost growth with calls for fiscal discipline.】

item.title: 沙特举债 500 亿美元反映财政压力增大
item.description: 就在华尔街重量级人物涌向利雅得参加达沃斯式会议的同时，沙特阿拉伯正在努力应对低油价、预算赤字和吸引外资的挑战。【原文：Even as Wall Street heavyweights flock to Riyadh for a Davos-style conference, Saudi Arabia is grappling with low oil prices, budget deficits and challenges attracting foreign investment.】

item.title: 新兴市场减少战争担忧，谢克尔涨幅全球最高
item.description: 以色列和伊朗在最新一轮局势升级中调整了应对措施，投资者对中东敌对行动缓和持乐观态度，新兴市场股市连续第二天上涨。油价暴跌拖累了货币。【原文：Emerging-market stocks rose a second day as investors grew optimistic of an easing of hostilities in the Middle East after Israel and Iran calibrated their responses in the latest round of escalation. Currencies were weighed down by a slump in oil prices.】

item.title: 国债的下一个障碍是美国能否保持售债稳定
item.description: 美国经济的韧性动摇了市场对未来降息的信心，国债市场也开始怀疑美国政府还能避免增加借贷多久。【原文：With its confidence in future interest-rate cuts shaken by US economic resilience, the Treasuries market is also facing doubts about how much longer the US government can avoid ramping up its borrowing.】

item.title: 英伟达本周大有可为，即使盈利还有一个月时间
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）预计还要一个月才会公布财报，但本周这家芯片制造商最大客户的财报将为其股价定下基调。【原文：Nvidia Corp. isn’t expected to announce earnings for another month, but results this week from the chipmaker’s biggest customers are about to set the tone for its shares, which are trading near an all-time high on optimism around the AI boom.】

item.title: 选举失利引发对东京金融中心建设的担忧
item.description: 日本执政联盟令人震惊地失去了多数席位，这让东京的银行家们对新政府振兴金融市场的承诺，包括推动其在资产管理领域的发展感到担忧。【原文：The shock loss of the majority for Japan’s ruling coalition is making bankers in Tokyo worried about the new government’s commitment to revitalizing financial markets including a push to boost its presence in asset management.】

item.title: S&P 500 盈利不佳，新赛季进入高潮
item.description: S&P 500 指数的公司盈利超出预期的比率是近两年来最低的，这一趋势可能预示着美股基准的下跌。【原文：Companies in the S&P 500 are beating earnings estimates at the lowest rate in nearly two years, a trend that could point to declines for the US stocks benchmark.】

item.title: 经济疲软影响炼油业，中石化利润下滑
item.description: 中国最大的炼油企业中石化第三季度利润出现萎缩，中国经济的困境和电气化交通的普及使中石化面临越来越大的压力。【原文：Sinopec’s third-quarter profits contracted as China’s biggest oil refiner increasingly finds itself under pressure from the nation’s economic woes and embrace of electrified transportation.】

item.title: 印度妇女影子银行在印度央行打击借贷之际推迟首次公开募股
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在印度监管机构下令包括小额贷款公司在内的一批影子贷款机构停止发放新贷款后，Arohan 金融服务有限公司将推迟首次公开募股。【原文：Arohan Financial Services Ltd. is delaying an initial public offering after Indian regulators ordered a group of shadow lenders including microfinance firms to stop sanctioning new loans, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 私募基金潮人即将抢夺您最喜爱的应用程序
item.description:
意大利公司 Bending Spoons 正在收购 Evernote 和 WeTransfer 等订阅工具，并准备再投入数十亿美元。【原文：

Italian company Bending Spoons is buying up subscription tools like Evernote and WeTransfer and is ready to spend billions more.

】

item.title: Pemex 首席执行官继承了世界上最低效的石油公司之一
item.description: 与私营部门的同行相比，国有石油公司往往更加臃肿，效率也更低。然而，墨西哥石油公司拥有约 12.8 万名员工，即使在国有石油公司中也是佼佼者。【原文：National oil companies tend to be more bloated and less efficient than their private-sector counterparts. Yet Petroleos Mexicanos, with a workforce of about 128,000, stands out even among its state-owned peers.】
